0: Republican presidential hopeful Jon Huntsman says the biggest difference between himself and front runner Mitt Romney is trust. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "He's morphed himself so many times that for many of the voters, I think they're going to find during an election that's based on trust, that they're going to have a hard time getting a beat on where his core is," Huntsman said in an interview aired Sunday on CNN's "State of the Union." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "You run for the Senate as a liberal. You run for governor as a moderate. You run for president as a conservative. Where are you at the end of the day? That's a legitimate question that people have," he told host Candy Crowley. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Still, Huntsman seemed to rule out the possibility of an independent run or declining to endorse the GOP nominee. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "I'll support the Republican nominee," he said. "That's what you do when all is said and done."
